title: Custom E-liter 4K
paragraphs: The Custom E-liter 4K is a main weapon in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3. It is the Custom version of the E-liter 4K.

In Splatoon 2, the Custom E-liter 4K is nearly identical in appearance to the E-liter 4K. The only difference between the two is that the Custom E-liter 4K has a sticker bearing the Custom logo on the ink tank.
In Splatoon 3, the Custom sticker is still present, but the color of the weapon's plastic grips/supports is now red instead of blue.
The Custom E-liter 4K was released on 14 October 2017 at 02:00 UTC.[1] It comes with Squid Beakons and the Bubble Blower and the ability to store a charge for one second.
- ▲ Has the ability to store a full charge for one second in squid/octopus form.
- ▲ Range when not fully charged is not reduced by about 20%.
- ▲ Time taken to fully charge is 2/60 seconds faster.
- ▲ Fully-charged ink consumption: 30% → 25%.
- ▼ Movement speed while not charging or firing is reduced by 8.3%.

- ▼ Range is decreased by about 15%.
▼ Max range: 340 units → 290.5 units.
- ▼ Maximum damage without full charge: 100 → 80.
- ▼ There is a glow while charging and gets brighter the more the weapon is charged, increasing visibility for opponents.
- Promotional image
- Holding the Custom E-liter 4K
- Shooting ink
- Front-most Octoling holds the Custom E-liter 4K

The Custom E-liter 4K returns in Splatoon 3's Fresh Season 2024 update. It has Squid Beakons and Kraken Royale, which is based on the Custom E-liter 3K's kit in Splatoon. The design has been recolored and now features a red plastic handle and shell, instead of the typical blue.
